intro: Fernandezia jordaniae var. jordaniae, commonly known as the Jordanian fern, is a rare and specialized fern species native to specific regions of Jordan. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that typically grow in shaded, moist environments. The plant exhibits a unique morphology with finely divided pinnae and a compact, low-growing habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss. Conservation efforts are crucial to preserving this rare botanical species.
